title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly easy and the main goal was to show your passion for the school and why you wanted to go there. I would recommend preparing your answer before but demonstrating your passion and speaking conversationally.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go to Georgetown?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Three steps and references. Quick and all interviews were virtual. Overall interview to offer process took around a month after I applied a month prior. Asked tactical and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Related job skills and application knowledge

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview to apply for the Walsh graduate School of Foreign Service at Georgetown University's Washington, D.C. Campus. I applied with a writing sample, resume, personal statement, transcripts, and other essay for scholarship application.
Interview Questions: I did not do an interview

title: Student Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with the manager for 30 minutes. Had a nice conversation but was not offered the job. When the opportunity remained available, I was hired without an additional interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UIS?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in a two-round style, first with program administration and then with program leaders. Questions were primarily focused on my experience, along with some questions about my qualifications that directly spoke to the role I was applying for .
Interview Questions: What is a strength and weakness you have.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with cover letter and resume. One in person interview with professor. One week later I was offered the position. The interview just covered my interest in the topic and any relevant class/work experience. It was very conversational.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Georgetown has a habit of ghosting individuals, because which is very unprofessional. I had my phone screening and then the first zoom interview with some indivudals and then nothing. I reached out to the hiring manager weeks aoart to see if I could get an answer and nothing. No one should have to reach out to someone twice and still not receive an answer!
Interview Questions: What do you think are strengths you would bring to the team?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: First, I received an email to schedule an interview, then set up a zoom call followed by an in-person interview. Overall it was good, I had the interview with the director of the center and another team member
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Leadership Styles

title: International Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: No interview required, just motivation letter and resume as well as grade list. They are eager for international ambassadors so that is good to mention in any case. You get emailed tasks which are flexible and you can sign up as you have time.
Interview Questions: Where are you from in the world

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: You go through two rounds of interviews, followed by a campus visit. You have to present your work to the faculty, and they will evaluate your profile based on that.
Interview Questions: I had to answer several questions on my work.

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Nearly 5 weeks between submitting and hearing back!! The first round was a phone screen, followed by a group interview nearly 4 weeks later. (They gave me Zoom or in person options.) Sensing a theme here? I had to do a 30 min presentation for a pretty large group. Lots of other smaller meetings -- about 5 hours total. I finally got an offer a week after that group interview.
Interview Questions: What do you do when a student wants you to find someone for them to meet with for networking?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: submit online application around nov via system and then receive the offer at Jan. Documents of resume, cover letter, transcripts are required. The process is pretty strategy forward and the university staffs are very nice.
Interview Questions: not applied to this block.

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: There were over 4 interviews over the course of five months, and a communications test. However there was good and consistent communication about expectations from the hiring manager and team. There was also some rescheduling.
Interview Questions: Describe a time. where you..

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: It was good! Talked a lot about my qualifications and background so definitely have your CV or resume on hand to be able to handle that. Also know why you want the position.
Interview Questions: What is your research process?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: After completing an application, it was a couple of weeks before the interview. The interview was easy to schedule and was conducted in front of a panel. The questions were straightforward, the panel seemed interested, and the questions were relevant to the director's position and my vision for the job.
Interview Questions: Ideals on recruiting students and teachers.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen, then in person with hiring manager and also with the full team. Overall process was fairly straightforward and the questions behavioral. It was an average interview process, nothing really stood out.
Interview Questions: Tell me how your prioritize handling multiple tasks; how did you do it?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. Almost always requires a graduate degree or at minimum, some graduate level courses completion . Offer was subpar when compared to minimum requirements. It’s great if you intend to enroll
Interview Questions: Why Georgetown University? And why this position has? Where do you see yourself in five years? Etc

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Took about a month. Quick fifteen minute call with hiring manager, a longer interview with the two people I’d report to, and then an hour long skills assessment. They then asked for another last minute assessment the day after which felt unnecessary and inconsiderate.
Interview Questions: What is your organizational style?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Had three interviews, one of which was very lengthy and then ghosted. If a company is going to make me go through a multi step process, have the courtesy of contacting me if I'm not right for the job.  I also rearranged my schedule to accommodate the interviewer.
Interview Questions: When would you be available to start?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, had a phone interview and then an in person interview a week later- then they just did not ever get back in touch with me. Very disappointing to have come in person and not receive any contact after having done so.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were pretty standard

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Only asked very specific questions about your research experience and nothing else. Only cared about how your experience related to the PI's current projects. Wants you to write 2 cover letters and read 3 journal articles before the interview. Did not say anything about their current research.  It was a one way interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research experience.

title: Working Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (New York, NY) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: She didn't really care about my qualifications, we just chatted. I had already given her a copy of my resume, which I think she wrote her report on. She also rescheduled the meeting several times. Only georgetown-specific question asked was why I wanted to go.
Interview Questions: Why georgetown, above all other schools, was where I wanted to go.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process - I was offered the position by my school's administration upon request from the professor. Selection is primarily based on success in the class/subject being taught.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgetown University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Reached out to the recruiter, then she sent me to Information session, then set me up with interview (online)  with unit that I wanted to work on, then they gave me the option to shadow the unit, then sent me an offer
Interview Questions: Why I chose to become a nurse

title: Event Management Services - Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions:
- Applied online via the student job portal
- had an in person interview with a couple members of the team which consisted of behavioral questions. The questions were typical such as "tell me about yourself, why this role, etc."
- the team will then reach out if you are offered the position
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I reach out to the professor who was working on a project I was interested in.  We spoke over zoom and they asked me how my skills and interest align with the project. Then an offer was made, it was very informal.
Interview Questions: Ask you how your skills and interest align with the project

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is more formal. I spoke with a recruiter who gave me some information. I discussed some responsibilities and asked if I would be interested. From there, candidate information was passed along to the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What processes do you have in place to manage your time effectively?

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly straightforward, about thirty minutes long.  We covered my experience and they asked very standard questions. This was for a student position so it was not very difficult.
Interview Questions: Describe how your past experiences were relevant to this position.

title: Ops Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I just want to be able to see salaries. I don’t really want to do a survey. Can I just see the salaries? I’ll come back to do a review on my job later. It will be great, I promise.  I have lots to say.
Interview Questions: I don’t even remember. It was normal I guess.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: It was good, friendly, personable and enjoyable - looks like a good place to work, in a beautiful city. the fact that this has to be 30 word minimum is a little ridiculous and that the whole program is locked unless you add it.
Interview Questions: Why did the previous person leave?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: The team was well organized in sharing an agenda ahead of time. I met with a variety of audiences as well as shared a presentation. Everyone was very receptive to questions I asked and made me feel comfortable and welcomed.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role and Georgetown University?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Easy. They are sweet and helpful. They care about the people they are interviwing with and are welcoming of any questions. They ask a lot of questions and are willing to answer any questions that we have as people being interviewed
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience in Economics

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions:
The process involved a phone screen and interview. I had the chance to meet various team members, answering questions about how I could translate my experience and incorporate program management and skillsets.

The team was kind and professional and described the way in which they expected this function would support the work. They explained how this role support student engagement.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was with the head of the institution. He mainly inquired about my background and skills, and then explained the institute's current and future projects.
For the second interview, he invited one of his group leaders whose research best matched my skills and background. This time we had more scientific and detailed discussions. In the end, they said they thought I had a good chance of getting an offer.
At the third interview, I received an offer, but I had to decline due to my personal situation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant! Supervisors understand the demands of being a student worker and are very accommodating and will modify the position to your skills. The interview questions were very basic but be prepared to connect your skills to the position!
Interview Questions: Have you had experience doing these skills before?

title: Business Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward interview process. Nothing too much to worry about. May ask about previous work with other universities. Also may ask that you take less money then maybe you have made in the past.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in higher education.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I’m sure it’s different for which function/school, but I was in a financial role. The interview process was a phone screen, then a behavioral interview with 3 coworkers, and finally the last one with leadership and I had to present my findings with data they gave me.
Interview Questions: Present to me your findings on this data

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Straight-forward and fair process -- phone screen, then in-person panel interview, mock presentation on an issue of one's choice followed by a question and answer time, and a series of individual interviews, including with peers and those one would supervise.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your personal brand?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: It was all very lovely! Everyone I talked to was so kind. They were very polite and made me feel quite welcome and excited to work there during the interview.
Interview Questions: They asked about prior experiences and what I was interested in.

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Contacted very shortly after application submitted. Communication between that point and interview very smooth. Panel interview, with about 2 managers and a staff member. Position was for a relatively small administrative office.
Interview Questions: Asked a technical/programming question on the spot - related to interpreting and parsing a particular programmatic script.

title: Garden Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Both the Pharmacology professor & her assistant asked me questions about my background while also elaborating on the project. Throughout the interview, snacks were provided and the atmosphere was welcoming.
Interview Questions: What type of gardening have you done?

title: Content Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interview was great, more laid back. The second felt like I was being grilled and had already been decided I didn’t have the experience they wanted for this position. The posted job description and take home test did not align with what the actual job duties entailed. Very conflicting experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your content creation process.

title: Student Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: One interview with director of center that was set up a week after I had applied. After the interview, I received a job offer a week later. Over all very easy process.
Interview Questions: When is your availability and time you cannot come in?

title: Program Coodinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I underwent two informal Zoom interviews that went very well and were not too difficult.  I met with the directors of the institute I was applying at and had a wonderful rapport with them. After two weeks of hearing nothing I wrote for an update and was completely ghosted.
Interview Questions:
What are some problems you ran into during your last job and how did you handle them?
Interview questions very standard.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and then an in-person interview with a panel of about six people. Both interviews were fine. Everyone was very relaxed and conversational. I had the opportunity to chat with some of the panel members before the interview started, so that helped me relax.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work there?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were professional and accomodating to a student schedule. I would recommend the experience to any student looking for opportunities to gain research skills. The experience will vary from professor to professor so aim to find someone studying a subject you are interested in learning more about.
Interview Questions: Behavioral, Research (current and past), Availability

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and direct. Questions are relevant to the job position.
Interview Questions: Do you have Canvas experience?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, cover letter snd writing sample. Sample underwent scrutiny and led to follow-up inquiries during the interview process. The process was initiated with a phone interview followed by an in-person interview with the director of the program.
Interview Questions: I was asked about Past teaching experience.

title: Writing Center Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was nominated anonymously by a professor (although this isn't necessary). I then had to submit written questions and writing samples. I then got invited for an interview, which was with the director of the program and two current tutors. I received the offer about a  week later. I then had to take a 3 credit training class with the head of the program. Not too time intensive after the first semester of classes/training. Would highly recommend working here since it is great for professional development.
Interview Questions: Current extracurriculars, why you want to be a tutor, mock session

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with the professor to detail my interest in the research in the topic and my goals upon graduation. After, we met in person to get to know one another and discuss the requirements of the job.
Interview Questions: How do your interests align with the necessary research for this project

title: GA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Ask about my past work experience. This job is detail-oriented so the interviewer, who is also the supervisor, asked about how detail-oriented one of my work experience was. Also, she double-checked my availability for each week.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about one of your experiences.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Application to hire took about 3 months. Applied online, then phone screen, then one in person. Everyone was professional and kind. The in person took about two hours. Met everyone i'd.be working with.
Interview Questions: The typical questions --- why do you want to work here?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: 5 interviews with different people, came in for multiple rounds. The first round was a whole afternoon with meeting with the recruiter and then people on the team. Basic behavioral questions most of the interview process.
Interview Questions: What do you want to work at Georgetown?

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Calls, asks questions etc. Just study the docs given and when they ask you if you'd persist, say you'd persist 3 times. It's just a standard phone interview I'm not sure if they reject anyone.
Interview Questions: How many times would you ask me for a "gift"?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Response rate was within 7 days of applying. Phone interview and face to face was scheduled timely.  Phone interview followed by an in person interview and a group discussion about the program and new direction.
Interview Questions: How do your experience elevate our organization?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: They checked my experience in research, capability of schedule, checking for my professionalism and adaptability in the college workplace for needs of professors and staff. They also checked my references within the school itself.
Interview Questions: Name one time you thought you were going to fail in your live but you persevered through?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a quick phone screener from the hiring manager's assistant, then I was scheduled for an interview. The interview took place with two people, it was fine but it was clear that neither of them had any particular knowledge of the subject matter expertise required for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you approach building this program from scratch?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: It all depends on the relationsship you previously established with your supervisor. In this case, you pick a professor who already taught one of your classes and thus knows you well. Performing in class is the best interview preparation you can do.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Senior Position In Data Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to the position and received message about 1.5 months later from a senior administrator to have a call to discuss the role and my experience.  On the call, we spend about 10 minutes to go over what the role will be in charge of and I go over my analytics and project management experience.  The senior then says oh you don't have experience in a certain area X, I'll relay that to the committee and the senior wants to end the conversation right there.  

I thought that was completely unreasonable, if not a complete waste of everyone's time because: 
(1) you can see on my resume already that I don't have experience working for X, what's the point of this call if that's the only question you are going to ask since you should already know the answer.  Also the job posting specifically says it's not required to have that experience.

(2) I have spoken to people who work in similar positions at other institutions, I understand what kinds of analysis, projects, and stakes such a role will take.  Many enter the similar position without experience in X and it's absolutely not essential to the work.  It is more important to have capacity to learn quickly, analytical skills, project management and team management experience.

(3) I wanted to ask more questions and drive the conversation toward the skills I have besides X that are directly translatable toward the position but the senior just ended the conversation without giving me a chance to speak.
Interview Questions: Only question was: Do you have experience in X

title: Academic Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then emailed back and forth with the director of summer programs. Interviewed with the director. The process was very straightforward and I got a response within the week.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have teaching? What experience do you have with curriculum development?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Questions: What was your career goal?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had two rounds of panel style interviews, each with a different set of people, one faculty and one staff. I also had to prepare a presentation to an audience of about 20.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with difficult people?

title: SPA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with basic interview questions. I spoke with recruiter on Skype audio. Recruiter asked questions about my resume and experience. I was invited to second round interview with the panel which consists of four people. After that is a writing/analytical exercise and then a final meeting with the senior managers.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with project contracting?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Ask you to introduce yourself then ask a few professional and behavioral questions, the process went pretty fast and the interviewer are very nice and will not give you a hard time.
Interview Questions: How do you think of the projects and what projects you will be interested?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Soomth and fun, He did  most of the talking  where I asnwers yes  or no. Just some general question about the job. I think it would be pertty easy for me to get the job but aperrently they have better options.
Interview Questions: Describe your research

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included a panel interview with 3-people (on the phone) that lasted one hour. I had 5 minutes to ask questions at the end of the interview. It was followed by a in-person presentation on a research project with time for Q&A.
Interview Questions: What makes you suited for this position?

title: Associate Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Ethical and kind process. Somewhat slow to get to final interview on campus. Staff were wonderful! Students are extraordinary. Follow up was quick after final interview. Given adequate time to review the offer and consider my expectations.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to become a dean

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: applied online through the university jobs board. days later i received a phone call from my future PI and discussed my previous work experience. following this interview, i went to the university and met with him in a formal setting. days later i received my job offer. i then accepted this offer. the end.
Interview Questions: experience related

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: First, it was a phone interview that was pretty short like 30 min. Asked general questions like what did I do before applying and where do I see myself in the future.  Then the second interview was formal in person. It was a long interview at least 3 hours.
Interview Questions: Specific questions of biology and chemistry

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: It was an individual interview. No group interview. There was a language proficiency test and written self introduction prior to getting an in-person interview. On-site teaching demonstration was also included. I was notified the result via email rather quickly, within a week after the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you explain a word students do not understand in the target language?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not as formal as most other places. The hiring manager asked some technical questions, mainly about the past experience. I think they want to make sure I am not exaggerating in my resume.
Interview Questions: Do you have direct experience in xxx?

title: Academic Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called within one month, which is the quickest I have heard back from any university position I have applied for.  Spoke to the head of the department and felt the interview went well.  The start of the interview was primarily focused on a more in-depth review of the job description, which was organized and very specific.  I was provided with a detailed overview of exactly what I would be doing if hired.  This was extremely helpful in highlighting more specific information about my qualifications.  I was then asked typical preliminary interview questions related to the job.  Overall this was a positive experience, however I was told I would receive an update the following week and heard absolutely nothing.  It would have at least been nice to hear even a decline email.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background and how your experience relates to this role.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very clear, although many steps were required (phone screen, two or three Zoom calls). They wanted to get the buy-in of the full team, which I thought was nice.
Interview Questions: How do you think you would fit into our culture?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Mount Washing, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was there for a un-paid internship interview so it was pretty easy, just couple of questions like why you want this position and what have you learn at class
Interview Questions: Why you want to get this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty nice. No hard questions. Great focus on the content on the resume. If you are a Georgetown student and wanna dive into healthcare/biotech this will be a great experience
Interview Questions: When will you graduate? Familiar with R?

title: Research Fellow/Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Video based conference with project managers and supervisor. After a video conference I had a  follow up call before being offered the position. Once I do so, I was quickly onboarded. I was living in another state and I was given time to figure out moving. I worked remotely for a few months before moving full time to DC.
Interview Questions: Why now? How will this role help your career path?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Adjunct faculty do not necessarily go through a formal interview process; their scholarship and teaching is typically known in advance and then they are hired. Faculty propose a class they would like to teach, or, they are asked to teach an existing class for the school.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for your basic background; Group interview with your future co-workers; Final on-site interview... The co-workers here are very nice. Be ready for a lot of behavior questions and some technical questions.
Interview Questions: Normal Behavior Questions

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got the interview in May 2017. Usually, it would be before April. It was a group interview with the committee of the Ph.D. admission program. They asked me several questions, some are related to the field, some are not. It went smooth.
Interview Questions: Q: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Investigative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: They asked me why I was interested in this role, why I was interested in the work of the center, and if I felt I could handle representing clients who've committed heinous crimes.  A lot of questions about the legal system and why access to counsel is important, even if someone is factually guilty.  They then asked me how I would respond in a variety of witness interview situations.
Interview Questions: Are there any issues or cases you don't feel you could be objective on?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: After a phone screening there was a peer interview followed by a one to one interview with the hiring manager. Both interviews were relatively short and the whole process only lasted about one hour.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to move careers? What are you looking for in your next job?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was with the PI of the lab I applied for. This interview went very well and the job description was very attractive. It lasted about two and a half hours, and he invited me to come back and meet with two other associates in the lab. This is when it started to go down hill. During the second interview, the associates made it seem like the lab had very little work-life balance and badmouthed different people who were working in the lab. They could not come up with any other benefits of taking the job other than the reason of, "The [PI] can give a great reference!" 

Then, after not hearing anything for a full week, the PI messages me the offer, almost 20k below the agreed upon amount. The offer was so low, that after taxes, the salary would be below the poverty line, for a position that required specialized experience and a higher degree. Sad, because the job itself was my dream job, if the job itself could get a rating: 5/5, the people however, kind of ruined it with their unpleasantness and dishonesty.
Interview Questions: What are your previous research experiences? statistical software comfortable with? Experience with human subjects (Phone/in person screenings)? etc. etc.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Received first run by phone discussing general questions about background, the reason to apply the position, what's interesting part for this job position. And then I received notifications within 1 week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief meeting with two team members one day, and was called back for a more formal interview where I met with about 5 employees on the team. They each gave their own insights into the position, and asked me questions, which were all relatively the same.
Interview Questions: I was asked to answer a few case questions

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through the Student Employment Website by sending my resume and cover letter.

I was interviewed the following week. They asked general behavioral questions and about previous experience working in an office.

It was a quick process and they gave me an offer a few days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to work on a team

title: RHO Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview, which was very straight forward and simple, conducted online. No problem at all to get through the process. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Good luck to anyone interviewing!
Interview Questions: tell about your customer  service experience

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick, interview process. I was first contacted by HR, then the specific interview department. I interviewed for two different jobs in two different divisions at Georgetown.  Helpful to know the jesuit values. They were very intentional and friendly. Asked  a lot of questions about  my undergraduate experience.
Interview Questions: How do you work in changing environments?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview went direct to in-person, no phone screening beforehand. There was a round two with a panel. The process moved along fairly quickly. There was campaign presentation before the panel. While the staff was largely female, there was no diversity at all, from either panel. Very surprising to see from a university which touts diversity and promotes a global mindset.
Interview Questions: Estimate ad revenue based on sample social posts

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was called into an office and asked interview questions.  It went well, but they had already hired someone else at that point.  A spot opened up a few months later and I was asked if I was still interested
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions

title: Community Outreach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my resume and CV and was offered the opportunity to interview for the position. I met with the director of the division along with another person in the team. I was offered the position shortly after the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in direct services working with patients?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a nice experience.  I was interviewed for a research assistant position by the professor for whom I was going to work as a research assistant.  He just spoke to me casually and told me the work I would be doing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a research assistant?

title: Energy and Utilities Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first round was an on the phone interview reviewing my resume, then there was an in-person interview in the energy and utility department with a group of the employees where they took turns asking questions during the interview process. The questions were fairly entry level, discussing my challenges and projects as an undergraduate student
Interview Questions: Name a challenge you had with a partner or teammate and how did you overcome it

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were two steps, a phone call interview and then an in person, active interview. It was a great experience and was super streamlined into starting at the company. I really enjoyed the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Coordinator for Curricular Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: You will meet with almost everyone in the department for several interviews throughout the day. Interviews will be held with deans, office staff, directors and program managers. Expect to meet with at least 10 people. Some meeting are in groups and others are one on one.  Other departments may be asked to also interview candidates
Interview Questions: What was a challenging situation you faced and how did you handle the situation.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed relatively quickly.  It then took a month for the salary negotiation and job offer to be finalized.  Overall it was an excellent job search and hire experience.
Interview Questions: Why would you like this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: My interview went great! I was asked the typical questions such as what are your strengths and weaknesses, what are your future goals, how do you handle stress, etc. I was offered the position a few days after I interviewed and accepted.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple projects?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  Around three to four weeks after I submitted my application, I got an email to schedule a phone interview.  The phone interview lasted for around 30 minutes.  Then I was invited on campus for an in-person interview and met with a few people on my potential team, it lasted around 1.5 hours total.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this position?  
What do you like about your current position, what don't you like?
Elaborate on your current roles and responsibilities.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: 1 week of phone interview and in person interview.  Everyone was lovely and very open to my schedule.  I felt so welcome! - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - -
Interview Questions: Previous Experience, future goals

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Selected for interview, you might expect phone calls or on-site interview. Once it is you had interview the outcome is notify within a day and will require you to start working once you have been approved by the school and finish setting you payment account.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with similar position?

title: Temporary Position- Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: One of the HR Directors asked me to complete a series of Microsoft Office software tests (Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint).   The testing software was good, unlike other software I have taken tests on that didn't seem to allow for multiple pathways to find an answer.  This software wasn't perfect, but it was ok.  I ended up scoring well.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to talk about what department you're interested in working in.

title: Senior BUSINESS OFFICER Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by the manager and several potential colleagues. Very congenial atmosphere and good personality matches right off the bat. Good communication and transparency and respectful dialogue throughout the process.
Interview Questions: How do you handle competing priorities especially when difficult personalities are thrown into the mix?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was really quick and easy, it did not take more than half an hour. I was asked why I wanted to job and about my past experiences and credentials. It was really straightforward.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly easy from what I recall. They have a temp service that supplies full time employees. Basic questions, nothing too tough. Met with hiring manager and then team prior to receiving the official offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: The professor reviewed my grades, spoke with my references, and assessed my intellectual abilities and character.  I spoke about my previous accomplishments and future career aspirations.  I also discussed how working as a teaching assistant would benefit the course and the students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a teaching assistant?

title: Community Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews with staff at the office where I had applied for a job. In the first interview, I was asked general questions — about my resume, behavioral tendencies, etc. — and soon received a phone call to schedule a second phone interview, which focused more on the job and relevant experience. I was told that I would hear about an in-person interview by a certain date, and that the hiring manager would contact me "either way." After their self-imposed deadline passed, I sent a follow-up email to reiterate my interest and inquire about the status of the job, but never received any sort of response to that email either. I'm fine with not getting the job, but completely cutting off all communication with an applicant isn't the best way to inform them they didn't get the job — especially if you tell them you'll be in contact "either way" and set a deadline for doing so.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of Jesuit values?

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: it was easy, i received a response to an email within a week asking to set up an interview. you can find most of these jobs on the student employment website
Interview Questions: please walk me through your resume

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed interview with supervisor, generally behavioral questions to gauge what kind of a person you are. Example questions are: how you can contribute, how flexible your schedule is, what you want to get out of the job? Also be honest about your hours or else your schedules will conflict.
Interview Questions: What value are you adding as a student worker?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I was called about an interview and the man told me he'd email me the information that day. However, I didn't get an email for 2 days. When I interviewed, it was an in person interview with 4 people. They asked a few questions about my experience and briefly explained the duties. They mostly wanted to know about how my experience would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Georgetown specificially? How do you prefer to handle conflict?

title: Community Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
All day interview. Met with a number of people at a number of different levels of the organization: vice presidents, managers, support staff, etc. Can be a bit tiring going from one interview to the next without much of a break. 

Prior to the all day interview, there was a phone two phone interviews: one with the team members and then the other with the supervisor.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in the position? 
How will you be able to prioritize tasks?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is really an informal interview. Recruiter asked to go over the resume and asked former research experience. And also the tech skills. And then professor goes over the project and asks for opinions. That is pretty much it. Very easy and less stress.
Interview Questions: What kind of research have you participated?

title: Husbandry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I had several e-mail conversation, they asked me for my CV and cover letter, recommendations and then made appointment for the interview with several people, where I discussed with each one about my experience and recommendations.
Interview Questions: Interview Questions were mostly regarding experience and previous job position. Interviewer asked mostly about my readiness to work and commit myself to the new job tasks, am I able to work in that environment, to finish all tasks and duties on time, do I have a flexible working hours, can I work on holidays and weekends,  do I take seriously my job and what is my short and long term plan. He asked me about my reasons why I decided to change my previous jobs and move to that new one.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was not a difficult or formal interview. The process mostly has to do with meeting a professor during the period in which you are a student in their course. For me, this was a professor in the accounting department.
Interview Questions: How would you teach a problem student?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got email asking for a one-on-one- interview about two weeks after I submitted application, just some behavioral questions. And and got the email congratulating me that I got the job
Interview Questions: what would you expect out of this position

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with a resume and cover letter asking to describe your most rewarding involvements on campus. Followed up with an interview offer a few days after drop period ended. Simple behavioral questions: Why Georgetown? What are some of your favorite classes? Describe your most challenging class and how you overcame that? Tell me about one of your most rewarding extra curricular involvements. Second round interview with members of the office, more behavioral questions regarding classwork and future ambitions after graduation.
Interview Questions: Why Georgetown?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great, the questions were pretty basic and they explained the process to me in detail. We talked a lot about customer service and what it takes to do great in this position.
Interview Questions: What systems are you familiary with.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview is a one-day visit to campus. You get to present your research paper and discussions follow from there. Then you spend the whole day interviewing with the faculty. Most are one on one, but there's lunch and dinner with two or three faculty.
Interview Questions: questions about my research projects and other behavioral questions

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: they were looking for student workers, the process was very basic and the interview was not difficult. I was told about the position and the responsibilities that I would have and I was asked a couple of easy questions such as my major and my available hours. the interview was very short
Interview Questions: there were not any difficult or unexpected questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted within a few days to set up a phone interview. The phone interview went well, and so we arranged an in person interview for the following week. The in person interview consisted of 4 separate 1:1 interviews with different member of the department the same day, each lasting for 20-30 minutes. I got a good feel of the office environment and the people seemed very nice, and enjoyed what they were doing.
Interview Questions: Did I think I was over qualified for the position

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was not a very difficult process at all. Applied online, got an email about coming in for an interview  a few days later. Was offered the job a week after that. Most questions were pretty standard interview questions. It was about a 20 minute interview with a few minutes at the end for me to ask questions about the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about 3 weaknesses and 3 strengths.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: No interview for the chemistry department. Submit application and show up for exams if invited to join. Had to take ACS exams on five subjects and pass at least four. You have two more opportunities to retake whatever exams you do not pass. Overall, it will take a semester to know if they will keep you or not.
Interview Questions: No interview. Submit application and show up for exams if invited to join.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. They called me a month later for a phone interview. Then two weeks later for a phone interview. Then finally an in-person interview. The questions werent hard. The multiple interviews however was the most that I had ever had. I am hoping to be hired but I understand that the competition is a lot.
Interview Questions: Questions were straight forward and related to the position.

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and met with office manager a week later.The position was a non-work study position. I met with several people in the office and chatted with each for 5 minutes or so. It was a small 10 person team. Later I met 1:1 with the office manager. This was the formal component of the interview. We talked about my experience with microsoft office and with office operations. We also discussed my involvement in activities and sports on campus so as to better gauge how much time I could commit per week. Chatting with people probably played a large role in my getting the position because interpersonal skills are such a huge component of the admin assistant job.
Interview Questions: Describe what you could bring to the table to make our department function more efficiently.

title: Athletic Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Very laid back, straightforward questions, quick and to the point.
dress professional, bring portfolio and references. Talk about prestige of Georgetown and ability to be an asset. Discuss likes and dislikes and enjoyment of sports
Interview Questions: Why do you want tho position?

title: Student Caller At Phonathon Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The entire process was very simple. I applied through the Student Employment Office website and received an email about an interview a few weeks later. The interview was very simple and straightforward. I do not remember the questions, but remember feeling confident in most of my answers. I emphasized my experience in communication and the interviewer really liked that.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with calling?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Waited months after job posting to contact me for an interview and was interviewed by multiple people. After initial interview met with Dean of the department and was selected for follow up interview with the Dean of the school a week later. Offered job quickly after second interview.
Interview Questions: Specific about functions of the job and to give an example when something did not go as planned/I messed up and learned from it.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied through an internal email I received with my resume and cover letter. The hiring manager contacted me several days later and requested a Skype interview or in-person interview, if I was available. I was traveling at the time so I did a Skype interview.
Interview Questions: What challenges do you foresee in this role?

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying through Georgetown's job portal, I received a call for an in-person interview. The interview was pretty straightforward. Since the job was customer facing, they were assessing if I was a personable candidate as well as competent in administrative tasks.
Interview Questions: The interviewers (three people) used a predetermined list of questions ranging from the cliché ("What is your greatest weakness") to specific examples of challenges in the office ("Something happened that you don't know how to deal with, how would you go about finding the solution and responding to the customer").

title: Applications Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Before even interviewing, they tend to get resumes of people with overrated experience for a position that really doesn't require as much. If you get selected for an interview, you will go through 4 - 5 rounds of interviews, starting from a phone interview, Skype, and in Person interview. They asked me for a writing sample, as well I got to know that they asked others for the same, by round 5, I was considered for the position.
Interview Questions: What challenges you will be facing for this position?

title: Medical Center Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Personally recruited from another sector of the university.
Interview Questions: What can you learn from the current members of the staff.

title: RHO Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: emailed the senior rho coordinator to get a job, got a response, answered questions with current staff, got the job.
Interview Questions: what is your spirit animal

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: There is one interview with two student coordinators, and once you get past that point there is another interview with the program director. It was not very difficult, and overall it was an enjoyable experience because the people are so nice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Assistant Director of Employer Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and transparent process. Courteous phone and in-person interviews. Every step of the process was explained well and the time of the interviewee respected as the duration was clear beforehand and each interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: All questions were pretty standard and were directly related to the position.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Professional
Interview Questions: None I can remember

title: Accountant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview.  They were looking for a very specific set of qualifications which I had and got the job. The interview consisted in a panel group of 4 including faculty members (although I was not working for a faculty member). Faculty members only place emphasis on university degrees and managers focus more on experience.
Interview Questions: Managers wanted to have specific comments on experiences related to the job.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication over the phone was very brief.  The actual interview was one on one basically just discussing my past work experiences and what I would be doing at Georgetown.  I met with a few other people that I would be working with to discuss my experience and what I would be helping with and right before I left they let me know they would like me to start the next week.  I thought it would be more involved.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't any question that was too difficult.  Mainly just talking about my past work experiences.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: no interview
Interview Questions: communication

title: Husbandry Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Upon receiving an acceptance letter , there were two initials interviews which me and the facilitator had together. They were very helpful and very detailed about the job function that was being applied for.
Interview Questions: there was not a difficult question involved.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the Georgetown career portal (I was a student at the time, so I don't know if that's open to the public) and was quickly contacted by the office. We set up an in-person interview with a few of the other office staff, and I got a call that day saying they wanted me. Overall, it was pretty painless.
Interview Questions: How would you handle situations that require you to multitask (e.g. answering the phone while dealing with a visitor to the office)?

title: Conference Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was brought and interviewed by two people. They briefly walked me around the office to show me the department and space. I was brought in for a final interview, with one additional employee.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work for the originization.

title: Georgetown Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Georgetown University
Interview Descriptions: Interview with clinic director was long. Asked a lot of questions.  Interview with other fellow was shorter but a little odd.  Asked questions about favorite websites that I review, etc., trying to get to know me as a person.
Interview Questions: Most unexpected: What top three non-work websites do you review each day?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with Hiring Manager and a few others from the team, felt like it went well, got a decision very quickly. Interview process was very straightforward and smooth. I was referred by the person leaving the job I applied for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: A very informal interview with the department chair, the incoming department chair, and the outgoing admin assistant.  It was all very low key and friendly.  Georgetown lacks any sort of recruitment office that makes these experiences more professional.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to move from a developed career in the private sector into higher education?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 1 hour where I got to meet the whole lab and a tour of the lab itself. The principle investigator asked me a series of questions what related to the work I have done in the past and why I am interested in this research.
Interview Questions: What kind of research have I done before?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Had one pre-screening phone interview and two in-person ones
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted a week later. Invited to come in for an in person interview with two staff members. Interview was very relaxed and pleasant, no really tough questions. I felt very positive after the interview but did not receive an offer. The process was very quick and I believe they hired someone who was a graduate of the university. I think in their eyes I was overqualified, or they may have had an internal candidate and were just going through the process.
Interview Questions: Given your qualifications, why are you interested in this position?

title: Grants and Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were held in person on campus. Initial and post-interview screening was done via phone, and the process overall was very quick. I learned about the opening at a non-university job website, compared it to the full description at the Georgetown website, and applying my own background directly, I was able to have a better conversation at the interview to present my ability and interest.
Interview Questions: What is your motivation for working at Georgetown University, compared to any other medical research or higher education institution?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basic interviewing and hiring process - painless.
Interview Questions: Biggest strength?

title: Multiple Student Jobs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview processes were always laid back and enjoyable. Just as much about familiarizing you with the position as getting to know who you are. Frequently the employer would give you a tour of the office, introduce you to your future co-workers, ask you about your experience and what you hope to get out of the job before finally discussing hours, availability, compensation etc.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakenesses

title: Head Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone calls (2) then an in-person interview. I spoke with my future supervisor and an alum of the program. In the interview it was 1 on 1 as well as a group.
Interview Questions: How I would balance academics and athletics

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview followed by one onsite. They pretty much did not ask anything, and the whole process took about 1 week. they gave me the offer right after the interview is finished. (on the same day) but being cheap with the salary.
Interview Questions: they pretty much did not ask anything.

title: Administrative Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The senior administrative officer will do a meet and greet, usually with the Chief physician in that department and with 3 other senior leaders in the group. After making a few rounds you will also briefly meet the staff that help run the operations of the department. The interview may last 30 minutes to 1 hour with the senior administrator. It's usually a review of the expectations and goals of the position in relation to the job.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit for this department? When faced with with a problematic employee in a difficult situation what would you do?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to position posted on a job board and was contacted by phone directly by the hiring managger (a peer of the position I applied for) for a screening within a week of submitting resume. She asked some basic questions and then determined and told me I was very qualified for the position and to come in to discuss the opportunity and meet the team.

We scheduled it for the week after which was right before Christmas. I went, met every single member of the team, incuding one potential boss on his way to a sabbatical (who tested my lanuage skills), as well as the would be boss who showed up 1 hour late having gotten caught in traffic. He was quite apologetic and the one I was with was very mad about the whole thing. I didn't meet with the peer who had called me as she was quite ill and home. I spent approximately 4 hours there and left with the feeling an offer was upcoming. I was extatic as the fit was indeed perfect and this position looked like it had been written for me. 

The holidays went by and when the 10th of Jan rolled around I emailed them to touch base, having not heard from anyone. I didn't get an answer to that email for three days. Finally I got an answer from the peer I hadn't met who told me that someone else had gotten the job even though my qualifications were (quote) "stellar" and that she was really sorry about it.

I have to say that I could not for the life of me figure out why. The whole thing made no sense to me. I had had fantastic contacts and everything went swimmingly I thought. Apparently I was misktaken.

I have over 15 years experience and use to coach people and I've never had this happen to that degree. 

I do not know what happened (other than nepotism maybe...).
Interview Questions: (in Spanish) You mention you can speak Spanish ... followed by 10 minutes of Spanish convo (which I was totally ok with).

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Pretty thorough - 3 interviews to include one with direct supervisor, one with the team, and one with the director of finance
Interview Questions: What would you add to the organizations culture

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very long...phone interview and two in-person interviews with multiple people. It spanned over a few months with lots of follow up. I don't know why they were taking their time, but in the end, it worked against them because I got frustrated. Nice group of people, though. It seemed like a nice work/life balance.
Interview Questions: I don't remember. Nothing too difficult

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the direct manager and then the team I would work with. Everyone was very nice and professional.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a student who is angry and frustrated? Describe what you would do and say to resolve the tense situation.

title: Technology Engineer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgetown University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2007
Interview Descriptions:
Very thorough questions.  I interviewed with several groups of people, who took turns asking a lot of tough pre-selected questions. 
These were other soon-to-be-coworkers, and were friendly. 
The office is an average corporate-type office, and the work culture is fairly laid back.  In this department, people may work their day starting anytime between 8 and 11 am.  One day per week working from home is also common.
Interview Questions: Specific industry-specific acronyms.  I didn't know them all - who can?
